meanings.definition: Excessive admiration or worship of books.
meanings.sent1: Her bibliolatry was evident in the way she lovingly caressed each book on her shelf.
meanings.sent2: The librarian's bibliolatry was clear from the meticulous care she took in organizing the library.
meanings.sent3: John's bibliolatry reached new heights when he started whispering sweet nothings to his favorite novel.
meanings.sent4: The bibliolatry of the scholar was so intense that books seemed to glow in his presence.
meanings.sent5: The bibliolatry of the book club members was so strong that they held a candlelit reading ceremony every month.

meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe's bibliolatry led them to build a grand temple for their sacred texts.
meanings.sent2: The cult's bibliolatry was so extreme that they believed books held the secrets to eternal life.
meanings.sent3: The bibliolatry of the bookworm was so intense that they bowed down to their bookshelf every morning.
meanings.sent4: In the land of bibliolatry, books were revered as gods and treated with utmost respect.
meanings.sent5: The bibliolatry of the historian was so profound that they saw books as portals to different worlds.
